docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Dec. 17 -- In its first nine months of operation, "Government by Committee" has proved more efficient in Uruguay than a "Presidential Regime" like that in the United States, Dr. Andres Martinez Trueba, President of the Governing...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Dec. 17 -- In its first nine months of operation, "Government by Committee" has proved more efficient in Uruguay than a "Presidential Regime" like that in the United States, Dr. Andres Martinez Trueba, President of the Governing Council and a former President of Uruguay, said today.
docs.abstract: Martinez hails use of exec com ruling system; cites action in recent crises and aid from Govt continuity despite party shifts

headline.main: URUGUAY'S SYSTEM OF RULING PRAISED; Former President Says Nine-Man Executive Council Has Proved Worth in Crises

byline.original: By SAM POPE BREWERSpecial to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: The United Nations General Assembly's rejection of a proposal for direct negotiation between the Arab states and Israel leaves this thorniest of all Middle Eastern problems as far from settlement as ever. In all honesty it must be added that even if...
docs.lead_paragraph: The United Nations General Assembly's rejection of a proposal for direct negotiation between the Arab states and Israel leaves this thorniest of all Middle Eastern problems as far from settlement as ever. In all honesty it must be added that even if the resolution had been approved it would not necessarily have had any concrete results.

docs.snippet: Efforts by Israel to increase exports as a means of strengthening her economy have recently been aided by the signing of bilateral trade agreements with other countries. While these agreements have been a help, Israel now looks upon ratification of a...
docs.lead_paragraph: Efforts by Israel to increase exports as a means of strengthening her economy have recently been aided by the signing of bilateral trade agreements with other countries. While these agreements have been a help, Israel now looks upon ratification of a commercial treaty with this country as a major step in balancing her present unfavorable trade position.

docs.snippet: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Monday, Dec. 22 -- Taking account of the misgivings of investors in various parts of the world, the United Nations General Assembly amended last night a controversial resolution on nationalization of resources before adopting...
docs.lead_paragraph: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Monday, Dec. 22 -- Taking account of the misgivings of investors in various parts of the world, the United Nations General Assembly amended last night a controversial resolution on nationalization of resources before adopting it by a vote of 36 to 4.

docs.lead_paragraph: Dollar draft indebtedness of Brazil rose $2,300,000 last month to a new high of $200,700,000, according to the monthly report on Latin-American export credit issued yesterday by the Federal Resrv'Bank of New York. The report is compiled from data submitted by fifteen participating banks

headline.main: Brazil's Dollar Draft Indebtedness Up $2,300,000 to New High Level; Reserve Bank Reports $200,700,000 Total After First Month's Increase Since April -- Latin America Generally Improved

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Dec. 23 (UP) -- The International Materials Conference last night announced its allotments of crude sulphur for the first three months of 1953, with the United States getting 1,190,800 long tons -- by far the largest share.

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Dec. 24 -President Juan Peron denied today that he was planning any important changes in his Government. He declared that reports that Argentina's former economic czar, Miguel Miranda, would return to administer the country's second...
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Dec. 24 -President Juan Peron denied today that he was planning any important changes in his Government. He declared that reports that Argentina's former economic czar, Miguel Miranda, would return to administer the country's second five-year plan were untrue.
docs.abstract: Peron denies Miranda will head Plan, reply to Dec 15 article

headline.main: PERON DENIES PLAN TO GIVE MIRANDA JOB
